page.title: 09Barkby Village
page.content:
Barkby has changed very little in the last hundred years apart from the arrival of electricity and telephone poles.
There is only one shop in the village. This sells almost everything and is the Post Office as well. The only other public buildings are two Public Houses,one of which is the Malt Shovel built before 1271,a Village Hall, the Pochin (Primary) School and the parish church.
The church is full of memorials to members of the Pochin family, who have been the dominant landowners for centuries and are still patrons of the church and live in the Hall. On the pulpit is carved: "Thy word is a lamp to my feet". Outside is the cemetary which includes some iron headstones.
